instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2442: What is A2442? A2442 is a model number for a 14 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2021 M1 with EMC 3650, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02098..
definitions.820-02098: What is 820-02098? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won‚Äôt charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
Hi‚Äô.
Sorry if it is a stupid question. I have for the first time a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mbp 2021 14‚Äù ‚Äúsuddenly stopped working‚Äù Said the costumer :-)‚Ä¶ i have found a harmless tiny liquid point on the LB. It takes 5v with low amperage (0.050 ish). what ever I connect (MagSafe 3 og usbc) the capslock flashes (1-2 times a second).
Does the flashing lock tell anything? I know I am ready to messure - I will:-). But has anybody seen a flashing capslock? 
thank youüôè

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
I didn't face same problem.
Check for corrosion, test the board alone on the desk.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
Hi‚Äô 2Informaticos.
Finally I had the time to pull out the LB. These <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> are all new for me, so Sorry if I am a moronüòÖ. Board alone takes 5 v and pull slow 0.030 up to 0.700 and galla down to 0.060 and again up to 0.6/700 amp. Sound like a short somewhere. But not obviously blown/damage anywhere. Do you have any idea?

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
Need to connect both charger and battery.
Not sure it this board starts correctly with charger alone.

Check if get steady voltage on the big coils.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message: Hi‚Äô again 2informaticos. LF800 is pulsing from 0.000 volt to 1.780 volt. Seems it has trouble firering up somehow. I do not have schematics but boardview so I‚Äôm a bit lostü•µ.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
Do you get stable <SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> stable 12,37 volt 
and <SIGNAL>3V8_AON</SIGNAL>? Hmmm‚Ä¶ <SIGNAL>PP3V8AON_PH1</SIGNAL> unstable‚Ä¶ 0.000 to 0.158
Same for <SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON</SIGNAL> on DV019 area
[/QUOTE]

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on other big coils and secondary power rails.
Compare with good board.

threads.title: MacBook Pro <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2442</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02098</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> flashing capslock
threads.message: I will search and Thank you for the linküôè. I will sent you the new information as soon I find news. Do your experience exclude the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>?
